alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 10:49PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR LOS ANGELES COUNTY UNTIL 145 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by moderate to heavy rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 145 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall will likely cause pockets of roadway flooding across Los Angeles county tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1045 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain across much of Los Angeles county. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inches per hour will be common across the county, with locally higher rates possible. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Long Beach, Malibu, Lake Los Angeles, Acton, Wrightwood, Burbank, Mount Wilson, Pasadena, Griffith Park, North Hollywood, Universal City, Palmdale, Santa Clarita, Van Nuys, Alhambra, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, Northridge and Beverly Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
